Bus Terbakar, Sriwijaya Air Tunggu Hasil Investigasi
04 Nov 2019, 13:41 by Made Argawa, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Maskapai Sriwijaya Air masih menunggu hasil penyelidikan yang dilakukan oleh Otoritas Bandara Wilayah IV di Bandara Ngurah Rai Bali terkait dengan bus penumpang yang terbakar pada Senin, 4 November 2019.
“Kami masih menunggu hasil (penyelidikan) dari Otoritas,” kata General Manajer Sriwijaya Group area Bali dan Nusa Tenggara, Hermawan, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Pihaknya juga membantah jika bus parkir setelah mengantar penumpang itu terbakar. Hermawan mengatakan tidak ada percikan api. “Cuman asap saja, seperti radiator kering. Tapi kami tunggu hasil pastinya,” ujarnya.
Ia menyebukan, kejadian tersebut tidak sampai mengganggu operasional bandara. “Baru pertama ini kami alami,” katanya.
Sebelumnya, keterangan yang Tempo peroleh dari Otoritas Bandara Wilayah IV di Bandara Ngurah Rai Bali menyebutkan, kejadian itu berawal sekitar pukul 08:45 WITA. Bus milik Sriwijaya Air bermasalah pada bagian mesin yang menimbulkan percikan api pada bagian bawah.
Bus berada di depan kantor Apron Movement Control atau AMC dan baru selesai menurunkan penumpang di terminal domestik.
Api segera dipadamkan dengan firex oleh supir bus dan melaporkan ke petugas AMC. Selanjutnya petugas AMC meminta bantuan petugas pemadam kebakaran atau Airport Rescue Fire Fighting (ARFF) ke lokasi pada pukul 08.55 WITA dan memastikan api telah padam.
Sebelumnya, pada 6 September 2019 pernah terjadi kebakaran bus di area Bandara Ngurah Rai Bali yang juga dimulai dari percikan api dari mesin. Bus ini bahkan hangus terbakar.

Bus Burned, Sriwijaya Air Awaits Investigation Results
04 Nov 2019, 13:41 by Made Argawa, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Sriwijaya Air is still waiting for the results of an investigation conducted by Region IV Airport Authority at Bali's Ngurah Rai Airport related to a passenger bus that caught fire on Monday, November 4, 2019.
"We are still waiting for the results (investigation) from the Authority," said General Manager of Sriwijaya Group Bali and Nusa Tenggara, Hermawan, Monday, November 4, 2019.
He also denied that the bus parking after taking the passengers on fire. Hermawan said there were no sparks. "It's just smoke, like a dry radiator. But we are waiting for the exact results, "he said.
He said, the incident did not interfere with airport operations. "This is only our first experience," he said.
Previously, a statement Tempo obtained from the Region IV Airport Authority at Bali's Ngurah Rai Airport said, the incident began at around 08:45 WITA. Sriwijaya Air's bus has a problem with the engine which causes a spark at the bottom.
The bus is in front of the Apron Movement Control or AMC office and has just finished unloading passengers at the domestic terminal.
The fire was immediately put out by firex by the bus driver and reported to the AMC officer. Next AMC officers asked for help from firefighters or Airport Rescue Fire Fighting (ARFF) to the location at 08.55 WITA and made sure the fire had been extinguished.
Previously, on September 6, 2019, there was a bus fire in the Ngurah Rai Airport in Bali, which also started from a spark from an engine. This bus even burned.
